hanzi-su-wiki:
計

Значения

Измерять; считать; распоряжаться, заведовать; присматривать за кем-либо; итого, всего

Мнемоника

  • Система счёта китайцев была десятичной. Говорить 言 до десяти 十, т.е. считать.

  • "Давайте измерять время, считая."

Варианты

计

jp_example_words:
家計(かけい): household economy, family finances
計器(けいき): meter, gauge
集計(しゅうけい): totalization, aggregate
生計(せいけい): livelihood, living
計る(はかる): to measure, to weigh, to survey, to time (sound gauge estimate)
会計(かいけい): account, finance, accountant, treasurer, paymaster, reckoning, bill
計(けい): plan
計算(けいさん): calculation, reckoning
合計(ごうけい): sum total, total amount
設計(せっけい): plan, design

jp_readingExamples: 計らう (はか.らう), 計る (はか.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you want to say how big a cross is, you have to measure it. You can't say the size of something without measuring it first.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine trying to use your hands to show the size of this cross, but the other person shakes their head and says, "Use your words!" Ugh, okay, you'll have to measure it then.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You need to measure this cross but all you have is a cake (けい). Good enough! I'm sure all cakes are exactly the same size, so they're a reliable unit of measure.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "This cross measures two cakes wide and three cakes long," you say.
Ru_trainchinese:

jì: (графема) счетчик, датчик; переживать о, спорить о (в отрицательных предложениях)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: with ten (十) words (言) you can arrange (something)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you are good enough you can describe a plan without saying more than ten words.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " speak " to " ten ", the original meaning is calculation and total. "Shuowen": "Meeting. Yunye. From words to ten." Duan Yucai's note: "Meeting, heye. Yun, as counting, counting." The original meaning of Jian and silk texts, such as "Sleeping Tiger Land" Qin Jian. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty" 117: "Don't count as (徭)"; "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty 140: "The Year of Ji Zhi Qi". The original meaning is also used in the handed down classics, such as "Zuo Zhuan · Thirty-two Years of Zhaogong": "Count the number of feet, and figure out the high and low."

" Ji " is often extended to plans and tactics, such as "Warring States Policy·Zhao Ce IV": "Parents' beloved son must have far-reaching plans for them"; Another example is "Historical Records · Guan Cai Family": "Zhaohou Private Xu, No Plan with the doctor"; "Guanzi·Quanxiu": "A lifelong plan is nothing like a tree man."

" Country " was later extended to economic power, such as in "Han Feizi: Unspeakable": "A small talk about family planning, if you use a few words, you will see it as shabby."

" Calculation " can also be extended to inspection and review. "Guangya·Shiyan": "Plan, school." This meaning is often used in pre-Qin classics, such as "Guanzi·Eight Views": "Look at his hard work, and count his farming"; another example is "Sun Bin's Art of War·Wang Wang": "Foreseeing the enemy's risk, we must observe the distance."
humanum_short_description_en: From " speak " to " ten ", the original meaning is total and calculation.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，從「十」，本義為計算、合計。《說文》：「會也。筭也。从言从十。」段玉裁注：「會，合也。筭，當作算，數也。」簡帛文字多用本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》117：「勿計為（徭）」；《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》140：「計之其作年」。傳世典籍也用本義，如《左傳·昭公三十二年》：「計丈數，揣高卑。」

　　「計」又常引申為謀劃和計謀，如《戰國策·趙策四》：「父母之愛子，必為其計深遠」；又如《史記·管蔡世家》：「昭侯私許，不與大夫計」；《管子·權修》：「終身之計，莫如樹人。」

　　「計」後又引申為經濟力量，如《韓非子·難言》：「家計小談，以具數言，則見以為陋。」

　　「計」還可引申為考察、審核。《廣雅·釋言》：「計，校也。」先秦典籍常用此義，如《管子·八觀》：「視其耕耘，計其農事」；又如《孫臏兵法·威王問》：「料敵計險，必察遠近」。
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，從「十」，本義為合計、計算。

①覈算：計時。計量(liàng)。計日程功。
②測量或覈算度數、時間、溫度等的儀器：晴雨計。溼度計。
③主意，策略：計策。計謀。
④謀劃，打算：計劃。計議。
⑤姓氏。

從「 言 」，從「 十 」，本義為計算、合計。《說文》：「會也。筭也。从言从十。」段玉裁注：「會，合也。筭，當作算，數也。」簡帛文字多用本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》117：「勿計為（徭）」；《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》140：「計之其作年」。傳世典籍也用本義，如《左傳·昭公三十二年》：「計丈數，揣高卑。」 「 計 」又常引申為謀劃和計謀，如《戰國策·趙策四》：「父母之愛子，必為其計深遠」；又如《史記·管蔡世家》：「昭侯私許，不與大夫計」；《管子·權修》：「終身之計，莫如樹人。」 「 計 」後又引申為經濟力量，如《韓非子·難言》：「家計小談，以具數言，則見以為陋。」 「 計 」還可引申為考察、審核。《廣雅·釋言》：「計，校也。」先秦典籍常用此義，如《管子·八觀》：「視其耕耘，計其農事」；又如《孫臏兵法·威王問》：「料敵計險，必察遠近」。
From " speak" to " ten", the original meaning is calculation and total. "Shuowen": "Meeting. Yunye. From words to ten." Duan Yucai's note: "Meeting, heye. Yun, as counting, counting." The original meaning of Jian and silk texts, such as "Sleeping Tiger Land" Qin Jian. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty" 117: "Don't count as (徭)"; "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty 140: "The Year of Ji Zhi Qi". The original meaning is also used in the handed down classics, such as "Zuo Zhuan · Thirty-two Years of Zhaogong": "Count the number of feet, and figure out the high and low." " Ji" is often extended to plans and tactics, such as "Warring States Policy·Zhao Ce IV": "Parents' beloved son must have far-reaching plans for them"; Another example is "Historical Records · Guan Cai Family": "Zhaohou Private Xu, No Plan with the doctor"; "Guanzi·Quanxiu": "A lifelong plan is nothing like a tree man." " Country" was later extended to economic power, such as in "Han Feizi: Unspeakable": "A small talk about family planning, if you use a few words, you will see it as shabby." " Calculation" can also be extended to inspection and review. "Guangya·Shiyan": "Plan, school." This meaning is often used in pre-Qin classics, such as "Guanzi·Eight Views": "Look at his hard work, and count his farming"; another example is "Sun Bin's Art of War·Wang Wang": "Foreseeing the enemy's risk, we must observe the distance."

jì
вм. 计

計

Значения

Измерять; считать; распоряжаться, заведовать; присматривать за кем-либо; итого, всего

Мнемоника

  • Система счёта китайцев была десятичной. Говорить 言 до десяти 十, т.е. считать.

  • "Давайте измерять время, считая."

Варианты

计

Radicals: 言, 十  (say, cross)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you want to say how big a cross is, you have to measure it. You can't say the size of something without measuring it first.
Imagine trying to use your hands to show the size of this cross, but the other person shakes their head and says, "Use your words!" Ugh, okay, you'll have to measure it then.
Reading Mnemonic
You need to measure this cross but all you have is a cake (けい). Good enough! I'm sure all cakes are exactly the same size, so they're a reliable unit of measure.
"This cross measures two cakes wide and three cakes long," you say.
